llm.feedback: Your draft has solid macro scaffolding and credible signal sources, but it doesn’t yet meet the 4-movers constraint, mixes the swing trade into the movers, and underdelivers on first-principles clarity and quantified, source-backed triggers. To lift to world-class: (1) reformat to exactly four Movers lines (2 Up, 2 Down) with the required fields, and move the ACMR swing-trade into a separate Trade/Outlook Plan line; (2) make each mover precise and testable: specify a first-principles driver (policy regime path, wage/price momentum, terms-of-trade, cross-border frictions), a tight “What to watch” trigger, and a probability anchored to explicit material evidence; (3) calibrate probabilities to the evidence rather than ad hoc, and attach citations only where facts/numbers are asserted; (4) ensure every factual assertion uses IDs from SOURCE MATERIAL and reconcile any conflicts (e.g., U.S. policy easing vs BoJ/EM signals) in the notes to avoid contradictions; (5) keep the Trade/Outlook Plan crisp and actionable, placing the ACMR line there if tradable, with precise entry/stop/target, risk-reward, invalidation, trigger, probability, and a concise confidence rating; (6) tighten wording to avoid hedges or vague statements like “bear risk” and instead name explicit regime channels (e.g., real policy-rate differentials, external balances, export controls).
